name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Indianapolis Northwest

reviews.text: Traveling through Indiana, and had a morning flight out of IND, so picked this particular property to stay the night. It was - while not really close to the airport - on the way to the airport, and based on the hotel's website, only about 15 - 20 minutes away, all freeway. Plus the midweek rate was pretty good - $98, and that includes breakfast and dinner (only M - Th for dinner).
reviews.title: Great Indy Stopover - Lots of Room and Great Service

reviews.text: The hotel itself was in pretty good condition - it's right on the corner of the beltway (465) and another busy street, but it was behind another hotel property and the Cracker Barrel next door, so it seemed relatively quiet. Definitely no noise issues. It seemed fairly new, not sure when it was built, but the rooms, hallways, common areas, etc. showed no signs of wear, and things were kept relatively clean throughout the property. One exception was the dining area - it wasn't "dirty" per se, but could have used a bit more attention during the busy eating times - dinner and breakfast. I think they keep it staffed fairly tightly - one or two people running it all, and they did a fantastic job at keeping the food and drink areas well stocked, rotated, and replenished. The table cleanliness is just a nit, didn't detract from the mealtime at all. The breakfast spread was great - plenty of hot and cold items, much much more than typical continental type breakfast spreads. Also nice is the "manager's reception" on M - Th evenings - it's really dinner, but they just have one choice...it's not a buffet. The night I was there, they had hot dogs, macaroni/cheese, and salad, plus free wine/beer if you want. Limited selection notwithstanding, it's a really nice feature - especially if you ever travel with a family.
reviews.title: High end experience for great value

reviews.text: The room was great - typical to Homewood Suites properties, had the bedroom, bathroom, living area, and kitchen with oven, full refrigerator, sink, etc. That's really nice if you are staying for one night or a long time. You can get food at the grocery store, and store it for cooking later. That was really nice, and they have a dishwasher to use, plus the plates and silverware you would need. That's also a great feature.
reviews.title: Quiet, family-friendly stay

reviews.text: They have the standard hotel fitness center and pool/hot tub areas. The fitness center was pretty small - one treadmill, one bike, one stairstepper, and some free weights. The indoor pool/hot tub area was pretty big - a lot of seating area. Maybe could have made the fitness room a bit bigger, but it definitely served its purpose.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.text: I didn't use the business center, but it was the standard one, looked like it had everything you'd need. Something nice was that the hotel had free internet - it's good to see that all properties are moving this way; it used to be just the Hampton Inns that had the free internet, now it seems like most Hilton properties do.
reviews.title: Comfortable,Clean, Very Good Value if you have to stay in the area

reviews.text: Travelers should not have any significant issues with this hotel, especially business travelers. First impressions upon entering the building are positive; nice decor. The common area used for manager receptions and breakfast is also well appointed. Front desk staff was friendly and professional. Hotel was clean and well maintained. My room was excellent (I stayed for two nights). Housekeeping did a great job. Pillows and mattresses were extremely comfortable. Dual zone heating system kept me warm. Showers had ample hot water. The room had everything I expected for a Homewood Suites. Yes, I-465 skirts right by the front of the hotel. For me, the road noise was not bothersome. Late at night there just isn't that much traffic, plus when the heater kicked in, the blower fan muffled any road noise (by the way, the heater noise was normal for such a unit). Ask for a rear room if you think traffic noise would be a problem. Big breakfast fans will be pleased with the neighboring Cracker Barrell restaurant within walking distance. Of course the food offered at Homewood is adequate for most people. This is a nice hotel worthy of your business.
reviews.title: Above average accommodations at the Homewood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been in a 1-Suite for over 3 weeks on vacation. The room and all its equipment were in very good condition. A small kitchen, living room, bedroom (king) plus a bathroom and a seperate room for the toilet and shower. The shower was easy to get in and out of. because of the low walk-in ledge.
reviews.title: Nice Property, Houskeeping's attention to Detail could be better.

likes.liked: — In-Room Amenities, King Bed, and Condition of Property
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping sometimes forgot to re-supply items.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Homewood for one night in February and again over the Fourth of July weekend. Great stay. Decent breakfast although the last morning we decided to walk across the parking lot to the Cracker Barrel. We've stayed at all three Homewood's in Indianapolis on different occasions and all are nice. What I like about this one is it's location and ease of getting to and from the highway. And they have a better rate which is always a plus!
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: We had to book a hotel on the north side of Indianapolis because my son was having surgery at the Methodist Sports Medicine hospital. We booked the Homewood Suites because I knew it was like an apartment with a separate bedroom and sitting room plus a full kitchen because I knew we wouldn't be able to eat out after the surgery. But we ended up not needing the kitchen because this hotel provided COMPLIMENTARY breakfast AND dinner (called the manager's reception which is only Mon-Fri). I can't tell you how great it was just to go downstairs to fix a plate for my son while my husband watched over him. And the food was GREAT! For breakfast....name something, they had it. (Try the blueberry scones!) Dinner that night was lasagna, garlic bread and veggies. Salad had plenty of extras and a variety of dressings. They had fresh lemonade....and free beer and wine. It was incredible. What a value! The cost of the room is what you'd pay for any decent hotel with complimentary breakfast so to get two really decent meals and very nice rooms with great beds....well you're not going to get better than this. My husband travels alot for business and has a bad back...so is extremely picky. He was very happy with this hotel.
reviews.title: It truly was a home away from home experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The couch and chair in the sitting room isn't the greatest but the beds are very good, high quality. The rest of the furnishings are beautiful....bathroom is huge, water is hot, lighting and internet are great. A/C runs quiet. Every member of the staff we ran into were friendly and helpful. We especially appreciated the front desk letting us check in early....we had just flown in and were tired.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at this location several times. Clean. Comfy beds (love the ceiling fan!). Decent breakfast. My husband wakes up much earlier than I do, so we really like having a separate bedroom with a door. I took advantage of the "e-check-in" the day prior to our arrival. What a great feature! When we arrived, I don't think we were at the front desk more than a 2-3 minutes before we had our key and headed for the room. I hope other Hilton locations start using this option. Great stay!
reviews.title: I'm a fan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean, the bed comfortable, the breakfast was good, and we liked the two-room suite concept. However, there were some areas that could use improvement. First of all, the couch in the living area was very uncomfortable. The kitchens in Homewoods are usually well-equipped, but this one had a very limited kitchen. There was no skillet and only one very small microwave pan. There were no pots that could be used on the stove. No kitchen soap. No ice maker in the frig.
reviews.title: Nice But Could Be Better
